tweet: Today, I'm glad to see these efforts are reaching many of the communities we intended to help.

I held multiple meetings with local officials, first responders, and law enforcement to understand the needs of our communities in crisis and we passed more than 60 bills to help address opioid addiction from every angle.
Last Congress, we made fighting this epidemic in our rural communities a priority.

This is a great program that allows us to visit other members' districts to gain perspective & appreciation for our colleagues on the other side of the aisle. We've been discussing areas where we can work together: ag, transportation, growing our economy, & others.

It's great to have my Democratic colleague @RepLBR in #IL13 this week. She's here as part of the American Congressional Exchange through the Bipartisan Policy Center. Lisa represents Delaware at-large and last year, I visited her district.

As the husband of a cancer survivor, it was my pleasure to stop by the Community Cancer Center to prepare gifts for National Cancer Survivors Day tomorrow. We celebrate the lives of those who beat cancer, mourn the many we have lost, & pray for the men & women battling cancer. pic.twitter.com/altBMRM56z

Last Congress, we ended the decade-long cuts that had depleted our military readiness and contributed to the increase of accidents. We can’t go back. We owe it to our servicemembers and their families to adequately fund our military.
The year Logan died, our nation lost more servicemembers to accidents than we did in combat. That’s unacceptable.

Logan graduated from Sangamon Valley High in 2012 & @RCCDecaturIL in 2015. He was an Eagle Scout & an active member of Life Foursquare Church. He enlisted in the Navy as an interior communications electrician and earned the National Defense Service Medal while serving.

This post office will not only honor the  life and service of Petty Officer Logan Palmer, but also a grave reminder of the risks our servicemembers take on every day and our responsibility to maintain military readiness.
Today, we're dedicating the Harristown post office as the 'Logan S. Palmer Post Office.' WATCH LIVE -->  https://www.facebook.com/RepRodneyDavis/videos/437102313734281/ …
